title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

11:56 <+sburjan> I don't know, friday it was working okay, and I don't see any new commit in that section.  
11:56 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: no, I can look at it a bit later (say half an hour). If you have time right now, go ahead.  
12:03 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: con you confirm the blocker ?  
12:04 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Which one, the WYSIWYG admin?  
12:04 <+sburjan> yes  
12:04 <florinciu> has quit  
12:04 <@sdumitriu> Not yet, finishing something else first  
12:07 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <ihalip> has quit  
12:13 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki

12:21 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: re the resizable option of input text areas CChrome and FF4 offers, we should define a standard, because there are a lot of them and I don't think it's optimal to create a jira for each one of them  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I'm starting to look into that JS error  
12:29 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: thanks, let me know if you need help  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Are you using a VM right now?  
12:32 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Why did you surround the content with a form?  
12:35 <@sdumitriu> In the admin section, it already is inside a form, IIRC  
12:35 <+mflorea> no  
12:36 <+mflorea> the configurable add the form, but in my case, the form is custom, so I add it  
12:37 <@sdumitriu> K  
12:45 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: This doesn't work, mixing prototype and dom:  
12:45 <@sdumitriu> firstChild.observe  
12:45 <+mflorea> where exactly?  
12:50 <@sdumitriu> Actually there's a lot of such mixing  
13:06 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I see it only in ListBox. Where do you see it?  
13:09 <abusenius> has quit  
13:10 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I'll commit soon, just got it to work  
13:10 <+mflorea> thanks  
13:11 <@sdumitriu> K, works, but there's still a bug, not sure if it's our fault  
13:14 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what VM do you want to use ?  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> I'm on IE7  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> Doing a final test before committing  
13:18 <+sburjan> okay  
13:27 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki

13:29 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: display: inline-block doesn't work on block elements in IE6  
13:30 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: where did I use it?

14:02 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: am I supposed to get a velocity error when starting OOServer on a improperly configured wiki ? Afaik I should get an error macro, not velocity stack

14:03 <@sdumitriu> It should be improved, indeed  
14:03 <+sburjan> ok, gonna report an improvement  
14:03 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <jamesxu> query lucaa  
14:04 <+sburjan> ;)  
14:06 <jamesxu> sorry, I just installed irssi, and tried to have a try, I always forget to type the right command, and it will be showed as a message.  
14:07 <nikhil88> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <cjdelisle> Hello, is XWIKI-6189 known?  
14:18 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: seen it when you created it but i did not looked, is is progress only ?  
14:18 <+tmortagne> s/is is/is it/  
14:18 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I've not seen it in hsqldb but maybe it's only for postgres?  
14:19 <vmassol> does it happen on mysql too?  
14:19 <vmassol> hmm even on hsqldb I haven't tried to import a full default xar in an empty db  
14:19 <vmassol> does it happen only on an empty db?  
14:25 <jstoldt> morning  
14:26 <vmassol> morning  
14:26 <jstoldt> regarding XOFFICE, i noticed something weird: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download#HXWikiOffice links to attachments on http://xoffice.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Repository/WebHome#Attachments  
14:26 <jstoldt> problem is that the supposely 1.2 M1 is linked to 1.0  
14:26 <jstoldt> while the 1.1 is linked to 1.1  
14:26 <jstoldt> looks weird to me  
14:34 <cjdelisle> I have not done anything with it because it requires removing things ( D: ) from XWikiPreferences.  
14:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <Avipar1> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <Avipar> has quit  
14:38 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: good thing is that we are doing that more and more :)  
14:40 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <cjdelisle> Agreed. I'm looking for good candidates to axe from the preferences class now.  
14:41 <\_\_fz> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <+sburjan> :))  
14:45 <\_\_fz> hi. i've got a wierd problem when trying to upgrade from xwiki enterprise 2.3 -> 2.7.1. since it's rather large i redumped the db and started a new instance. when i try to import the default 2.7.1 pages from xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.7.1.xar nothing happens when i click import  
14:45 <\_\_fz> i tried different browsers  
14:46 <\_\_fz> i get no output log output when clicking import, however when i enter the "import page" jetty/xwiki log "java.io.IOException: mark/reset not supported"  
14:47 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: A good one is LDAP, I have some ideas to refactor LDAP configuration (for multi server support mostly) but what I need is time as always :)  
14:48 <+tmortagne> checking if i created an issue for it so that i can link them  
14:48 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: doesn't it work with what sdumitriu removed already ?  
14:50 <vmassol> there's an issue for having a LDAP config UI  
14:51 <+tmortagne> vmassol: that's something else  
14:51 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2551  
14:51 <+tmortagne> here the issue is to change where the configuration is  
14:51 <vmassol> well it can be done at the same time...  
14:51 <+tmortagne> will come with XWIKI-2577 actually  
14:52 <+tmortagne> it's not because you need an UI that you change how it's working :)  
14:52 <+tmortagne> it's not just a move for a move  
14:52 <+tmortagne> XWIKI-2577 is a good reason to refactor  
14:54 <cjdelisle> I don't know. When I opened it I was dealing with trunk, I haven't tested again since.  
14:56 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I think sdumitriu did his commit after you create the issue it's probably enough for now to make it work  
14:56 <cjdelisle> WDYT of dropping macros\_\*? It's all based on the 1.0 renderer.  
14:56 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: well 1.0 renderer is still here :)  
14:57 <+tmortagne> depends what its breaking  
14:57 <cjdelisle> If someone is upgrading they won't be installing the new XWikiPreferences. Do you still support the 1.0 renderer for new installations?  
14:58 <cjdelisle> Also they can of course add it back.  
14:58 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:58 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: 1.0 is bundled in XE so I guess we support it  
14:58 <cjdelisle> hmm  
14:59 <+tmortagne> i agree that will be hard to get rid of this support seen that way  
14:59 <cjdelisle> I'm liking the "replace and remove" pattern less and less. It seems to stop at the "and" part  
15:00 <vmassol> not really, there's a huge code base using the 1.0 syntax  
15:00 <vmassol> we're still using it even in the latest XE 3.0  
15:00 <cjdelisle> And we don't maintain it.  
15:00 <vmassol> we do  
15:00 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: not exactly  
15:00 <vmassol> but not improve  
15:00 <+tmortagne> we do'nt improve iot  
15:01 <+tmortagne> but we fix most of the bugs we find  
15:01 <cjdelisle> My concern is that the "replace and remove" pattern is not proven to work.  
15:01 <vmassol> why?  
15:02 <vmassol> it's just a long path  
15:02 <vmassol> since it's a migration path  
15:02 <cjdelisle> Because so far it is "replace and leave"  
15:02 <vmassol> not true  
15:02 <vmassol> we've removed a lot of things  
15:02 <vmassol> they've been replaced by newer implementations  
15:02 <vmassol> contrib/retired shows them  
15:03 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: sdumitriu just removed lots of plugins ;)  
15:03 <+tmortagne> and we removed a lot more before that  
15:04 <+tmortagne> there is stuff like 1.0 syntax which takes a lot more time to get rid of of course but well a lot of people still use it  
15:04 <vmassol> if you mean that it's slower than just breaking things by implementing the new one directly then yes you're right :)  
15:04 <cjdelisle> implementing a new one directly?  
15:05 <vmassol> without taking care of breaking backward compat for existing users  
15:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <vmassol> the other option (which cannot guarantee backward compat btw) is to provide a migration script instead  
15:06 <cjdelisle> The pattern I chose with attachments was to write a new implementation and then bridge the new implementation back to the old api. It proved to be a horror to get the compatability right though.  
15:06 <vmassol> ie code the new stuff and provide the migration tool, and remove the old code  
15:06 <vmassol> yes the problem with this approach  
15:06 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
15:06 <vmassol> is that you cannot usually gurantee backward compat or it's hard  
15:06 <vmassol> but it's a good approacj  
15:06 <vmassol> for some domains  
15:06 <vmassol> it's harder for others  
15:06 <vmassol> for rendering 1.0 it's hard  
15:07 <vmassol> we kind of doing it with the 1.0 syntax parser in the new rendering  
15:07 <vmassol> but it's far from perfect and not good enough  
15:07 <vmassol> to ensure backward copat  
15:07 <vmassol> s/copat/compact/  
15:08 <cjdelisle> If we support rendering1.0 because we have legacy installations, and because we support it, we support it absolutely (IE new installations can use it) then new installations immeditely become legacy installations. It's a self fulfilling prophecy.  
15:08 <vmassol> the problem is that since xwiki 1.0 syntax is not deterministic  
15:08 <vmassol> it's not possible to do it automaitcally  
15:08 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <+tmortagne> and that 1.0 syntax also mean a lot of not syntax related stuff  
15:12 <+tmortagne> where is properly separated in new rendering  
15:12 <+tmortagne> (at least we try :))  
15:13 <cjdelisle> Yup. Thinking more about it, I think a legacy configuration switch is a requirement.  
15:13 <cjdelisle> Otherwise we will never run out of legacy installations.  
15:14 <cjdelisle> And have to support everything (which was at one time popular) forever.  
15:14 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: either that or upgrade script converting configuration  
15:14 <cjdelisle> Converting configuration?  
15:15 <+tmortagne> you were talking about configuration  
15:15 <+tmortagne> legacy configuration  
15:15 <cjdelisle> My thinking is that old installations will take their old config with them so they will still have the legacy functions available.  
15:16 <+tmortagne> when there is a equivalent from xwiki.cfg old stuff to something in xwiki.properties or somewhere else we could execute a script whci apply the same old configuration  
15:16 <+tmortagne> for example when refactoring LDAP configuration (writing the design page now ;))  
15:16 <cjdelisle> Yes, if there is a perfect equivilent then you can convert config.  
15:17 <+tmortagne> yep i don't say there is always one  
15:17 <+tmortagne> but it's usually easier for most of the configuration  
15:17 <+tmortagne> and someonee it avoid having to do very crappy things in the new code to support old config  
15:17 <+tmortagne> sometimes  
15:18 <cjdelisle> For rendering1.0, I think the only way we can save ourselves is to start shipping xwiki.cfg files which have it disables.  
15:18 <cjdelisle> So you need to "opt in"  
15:18 <vmassol> for rendering 1.0 what we want to do:  
15:18 <vmassol> 1) move all pages to 2.0 syntax  
15:18 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: that would be a first step indeed  
15:18 <vmassol> 2) move code in a separate module  
15:18 <vmassol> 3) don't bundle that module by default  
15:18 <+tmortagne> but when ourself are using only 2.0 :)  
15:18 <cjdelisle> 2) is hell AFAICT.  
15:19 <vmassol> well for 2) it means  
15:19 <vmassol> a) introduce template module  
15:19 <vmassol> b) introduce presentation module  
15:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: don't need xwiki/1.0 syntax for templates  
15:19 <+tmortagne> it's pure html  
15:19 <vmassol> right  
15:19 <vmassol> not a strict req  
15:20 <+tmortagne> but it's hard to move code in the xwiki/1.0 syntax case  
15:20 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/FrontEndArchitecture  
15:20 <+tmortagne> because it's a bit all other the place  
15:20 <cjdelisle> ^  
15:20 <+tmortagne> but a not enable it is a good first step  
15:20 <+tmortagne> so that at least user can't use it by default  
15:20 <cjdelisle> Should I send a proposal?  
15:21 <vmassol> (actually not right link)  
15:21 <vmassol> I'm also +1 not to enableit by default for 3.x cycle  
15:21 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: you plan to convert all existing app to 2.0 syntax quickly ? :)  
15:21 <vmassol> indeed  
15:21 <vmassol> this needs to be finished first and also for 3.x  
15:22 <vmassol> not much remaining  
15:22 <+tmortagne> even if agree we have been vay lazy on that  
15:22 <vmassol> sdumitriu was working on panels  
15:22 <vmassol> he wanted to commit it for 3.0 but didn't get the time  
15:22 <+tmortagne> and that 3.x wa sthe right taget to disable 2.0 syntax :(  
15:22 <cjdelisle> Ahh I see.  
15:22 <vmassol> once panels app is converted then there are only a few pages more to convert  
15:22 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is more that panels remaining i think  
15:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes but it represents a large potion of what remains to be done  
15:23 <+tmortagne> there is XEM too  
15:23 <vmassol> checking  
15:23 <vmassol> ah yes  
15:23 <vmassol> had not counted xem  
15:23 <+tmortagne> it's not 100 pages but it's some  
15:23 <vmassol> stats app  
15:24 <vmassol> and then  
15:24 <vmassol> ? XWiki.OfficeImporter  
15:24 <vmassol> ? XWiki.WatchListMessage  
15:24 <vmassol> ? XWiki.WebDAV  
15:24 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I don't see the r36064 commit  
15:24 <vmassol> and we're done for XE  
15:24 <vmassol> default XE  
15:24 <krh\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: we could also separate ability to choose 1.0 syntax for a new page vs engine supporting existing 1.0 syntax if we really want  
15:25 <vmassol> (but not sure it's worth it)  
15:25 <+tmortagne> vmassol: pretty sure we do already  
15:26 <+tmortagne> listed syntaxe used to be some list generated in js  
15:26 <+tmortagne> (don't say it's right :))  
15:27 <cjdelisle> Anything we can lock down is a benefit but there's so much more benefit from disabling it entirely.  
15:27 <+tmortagne> also i doubt the page is not rendered when it use a syntax not in the configuration  
15:27 <+tmortagne> XWikiDocument#getRenderedContent does not look at this configuration AFAIK  
15:27 <+tmortagne> so whatever the configuration it should work i think  
15:28 <+tmortagne> but when you try to edit it...  
15:28 <+tmortagne> that will not work indeed  
15:30 <cjdelisle> Also Http meta info. That's syntax1.0 parsed.  
15:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: i doubt this needs 1.0 syntax to be listed in the configuration  
15:33 <+tmortagne> disable 1.0 syntax would just disable it in the UI list chooser basically  
15:33 <+tmortagne> we don't have any configuration to really disable it AFAIK  
15:34 <vmassol> yes but we need to move translations + other places using velocity renderer to use the new rendering  
15:34 <vmassol> so that we can move the old rendering in its own module  
15:34 <vmassol> without creating a cyclic dep  
15:34 <vmassol> (new rendering or simply velocity module)  
15:39 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: are we officially able to order objects with the UI ? I mean can we count on it in a configuration ?  
15:41 <+tmortagne> for an objects based configuration  
15:52 <+mflorea> guys, any blockers for 3.0 final? I'm looking at the failing selenium tests and then I'll start the release.  
15:52 <+sburjan> mflorea: I see sdumitriu fixed the blocker i found, but I can't see the commit.  
15:52 <+mflorea> how do you know that he fixed it if you don't see his commit?  
15:52 <cjdelisle> I'll test to see if XWIKI-6189 is fixed  
15:53 <+mflorea> sburjan: which blocker issue are you referring to?  
15:53 <+sburjan> from the jira. he usually puts the revision there
